business.headline: India slashes import duty on bourbon whisky to 100% after Trump's criticismThe reduction in customs duty on bourbon whisky was notified on February 13 just ahead of Prime Minister Narendra Modi's talks with US President Donald Trump.
What is digital lending? 5 key benefits you should know Digital lending platforms make use of advanced technology, thereby making the loan process faster, simpler and more efficient.

New Income Tax bill: Has it really been simplified for taxpayers?The proposed income tax bill seeks to simplify and revamp the Income Tax Act of 1961, which has often been criticised for its complexity, making it challenging for ordinary taxpayers to navigate.
New UPI transaction rule: All you need to know about auto chargeback processThe changes are primarily regarding auto acceptance and rejection of chargebacks, thereby making the system more efficient.
Sensex, Nifty end lower as FIIs continue to exit Dalal StreetThe S&P BSE Sensex lost 199.76 points to end at 75,939.21, while the NSE Nifty50 lost 102.15 points to close at 22,929.25.

Explained: Why Vodafone Idea share price tumbled nearly 6%VI shares were down 5.09% to Rs 8.22 at around 3:15 pm. Earlier during the trading session, shares of the telecom operator fell as much as 6%.

Ambani family richest in Asia. Check which Indian families made the top 20The Ambani family tops Bloomberg's list of Asia's 20 richest families. The family's flagship company, Reliance Industries, is presently headed by Mukesh Ambani, son of late industrialist Dhirubhai Ambani.

RBI curbs on New India Co-operative Bank: How does it impact customers?New India Co-operative Bank has been struggling with financial losses in recent years. According to its annual report, the bank recorded a loss of Rs 22.78 crore in the financial year ending March 2024, following a loss of Rs 30.75 crore in the previous year.

New India Co-operative Bank's financial operations halted after notice from RBIThe Reserve Bank of India (RBI) has restricted Mumbai-based New India Co-operative Bank from issuing loans, accepting deposits, or permitting withdrawals for six months. The move comes amid concerns over the bank's financial health and liquidity.

Not Trump's tariffs, but this is what's making stock market investors anxiousThe stock market jitters have occurred despite government measures, including tax relief and the Reserve Bank of India's (RBI) decision to reduce the repo rate by 25 basis points.

RBI issues notice to halt all financial operations of New India Co-operative BankRBI's move comes after what it called 'recent material developments' at the bank. Although the central bank did not provide specific details, it stated that these directions were issued to protect depositors' interests.

New income tax bill: All you questions answeredThe new income tax bill, compared to the Income Tax Act, 1961, is nearly half the size, containing 259,676 words, 23 chapters, 536 sections, 57 tables and 46 formulae.

Sensex tanks over 600 points: Why is the stock market down today?The Sensex and Nifty fell sharply after rising in early trade. Here are three things you need to know about today's stock market weakness.

Explained: Why Senco Gold shares crashed 20% after Q3 results Senco Gold share price: In the third quarter, Senco Gold reported a nearly 70% drop in consolidated net profit to Rs 33 crore, compared to Rs 109 crore in the same period last year.

Sensex, Nifty gain as US-India trade talks show positive signsThe S&P BSE Sensex was up 86.75 points to 76,225.72, while the NSE Nifty50 added 12.50 points to 23,043.90 as of 9:46 AM.
Nasdaq rises over 1% on inflation relief; Tesla soars 6%, Nvidia up 4%The Nasdaq Composite jumped 1.5%, the S&P 500 gained 1.04%, and the Dow Jones Industrial Average rose 0.77%

New Income Tax bill explained: What's changing and what's notNew Income Tax bill: It aims to simplify the existing Income Tax Act, 1961, by making it more structured and easier to understand. If passed, the new law will come into effect from April 1, 2026.

EPFO likely to maintain 8.25% interest rate on PF deposits EPFO interest rate: In 2024-25, EPFO processed over 50.8 million claims worth Rs 2.05 lakh crore when compared to 44.5 million claims amounting to Rs 1.82 lakh crore settled in the previous year, as per the official data.

Adani Green Energy exits Sri Lanka wind power deal; stock down 1%Adani Green Energy shares: As per the agreement with Sri Lanka, Adani Green was to construct two wind power projects in Mannar town and Pooneryn village, both located in the northern province of the country.

Sensex, Nifty erase gains to end lower as IT stocks weigh in on stock marketsThe S&P BSE Sensex was down by 32.11 points to close at 76,138.97, while the NSE Nifty50 lost 13.85 points to end at 23,031.40.

Finance Minister Nirmala SItharaman introduces new Income Tax Bill in Lok SabhaFinance Minister Nirmala Sitharaman tabled the new Income Tax bill in Lok Sabha amid the huge uproar by the opposition MPs. The bill will now be referred to the Select Committee of Lok Sabha for further review.
New Income Tax Bill tabled in Lok Sabha, faces select panel reviewThe government, in a bid to simplify the present Income Tax Act, 1961, has introduced a new income tax bill in Parliament today.

Explained: Why are large-cap mutual funds back in demandWith small-cap and mid-cap stocks experiencing corrections, investors are moving towards large-cap funds, which are considered safer and more stable in volatile times.

Quality Power IPO: 10 things investors must know before subscribing Quality Power Electrical Equipments Limited offers high-voltage electrical equipment and solutions for grid connectivity and energy transition.

Ajax Engineering IPO: Check allotment status, listing date and latest GMPAjax Engineering IPO allotment status: The IPO price band was set at Rs 599 to Rs 629 per share. The minimum lot size for the application was 23 shares. For retail investors, the minimum investment required was Rs 13,777.

New Income Tax Bill to be tabled today: Here's what you can expectNew Income Tax Bill is expected to come into effect on April 1, 2026. The bill aims to simplify tax laws, remove outdated provisions, and make compliance easier for taxpayers.

Can a married couple save more taxes using both old and new tax regime?Married couples need to determine which tax regime offers lower tax liability for each spouse considering their income structure and deductions.

India's retail inflation dips to 4.31% in January, hits a five-month lowThe country's retail inflation witnessed a drop in January majorly due to declining food prices, according to data released by the National Statistics Office on Wednesday.

Sensex, Nifty recover sharply but end in red; M&M falls 3%The S&P BSE Sensex settled 122.52 points lower at 76,171.08. Earlier in the day, the 30-share index had plunged 850 points. Nifty, too, recovered strongly to end 26.55 points lower at 23,045.25.

Mutual fund inflows see slight dip in January. Here's whyThe flows declined 3.6% month-on-month to 396.88 billion rupees ($4.57 billion) from 411.56 billion rupees in December 2024, according to data by the Association of Mutual Funds in India (AMFI).

New Income Tax Bill to introduce simpler 'tax year' concept: All you need to knowWhen the Income Tax Act of 1961 came into being it had 880 pages. Over the years, the act contained several amendments introduced in the various budgets.

Stock market bloodbath: Should buy the dip, exit or stay invested? The stock market correction has particularly hit retail investors, many of whom are contemplating selling their holdings at a loss. But is that the right move?

After 90-hour workweek remark, L&T chief stirs work-from-home debateThis is not the first time that the L&T Chairman's remarks have sparked a debate.  Earlier, he advocated a 90-hour workweek, which drew huge criticism.

Will retail inflation cool down further in January? Here's all you need to know The RBI mentioned continued reduction in rice prices and sharp corrections in the prices of vegetables, especially in the prices of onions, potatoes and tomatoes, in its January 2025 Bulletin.

L&T chief stirs fresh row with remark on labour crisis: Workers unwilling to moveSpeaking at CII's Mystic South Global Linkages Summit 2025 in Chennai, Subrahmanyan spoke about the difficulties faced by the construction industry in hiring and mobilising workers.

Sensex falls 700 points: 4 reasons why stock market is falling todayStock market crash: The S&P BSE Sensex plunged over 850 points before trimming some losses, trading 748.13 points lower at 75,545.47 by 10:23 am. The NSE Nifty50 also slipped nearly 1%, reflecting weakness across broader markets.

entertainment.headline: Watch: Ed Sheeran pauses Delhi concert as fan faints, wears Team India jerseyEd Sheeran wrapped up his India tour in Gurugram on February 15. He paused his concert briefly to help a fan who fainted.

Shalin Bhanot reacts to India's Got Latent Row, advocates self-disciplineTV actor Shalin Bhanot has reacted to the controversy surrounding YouTuber Ranveer Allahbadia's comment on India's Got Latent during the FDCI's India Men's Weekend in Jaipur. He emphasised self-discipline and responsibility.

Today is a victory: Jay-Z reacts after rape lawsuit against him droppedIn a significant legal victory, rapper Jay-Z has seen a sexual assault lawsuit against him dismissed. The rapper and entrepreneur expressed relief and satisfaction over the court's decision.

No one can save him: Mahabharat actor threatens Ranveer Allahbadia Actor Saurav Gurjar openly threatened Ranveer Allahbadia over his recent remarks on India's Got Latent. In a video message, the actor requested the government to take strict action against the podcaster.

Drake releases new album amid feud with Kendrick Lamar, fails to impress fansDrake appears to have ended his feud with Kendrick Lamar in his latest album, but fans remain unimpressed. Released on Valentine's Day, the album in collaboration with PartyNextDoor marks his first new work since the Super Bowl halftime show.

Bharti Singh supports Samay Raina amid India's Got Latent controversyComedian Bharti Singh supported Samay Raina amid the India's Got Latent controversy. The comedian praised Samay and said that he is very sweet, and anyone can become his fan once they get to meet him.

Women's panel summons Elvish Yadav over remarks against Chum Darang on Feb 17YouTuber Elvish Yadav has been summoned by a women's panel following his racist remarks against Chum Darang. Yadav criticised her name and nationality, sparking courage among northeastern citizens.

Apoorva Mukhija aka Rebel Kid removed from official IIFA ambassador listApoorva Mukhija, known as Rebel Kid, has been removed from the IIFA ambassador list following controversy over her appearance in Samay Raina's show, India's Got Latent. The decision follows threats from Karni Sena to disrupt her upcoming shoot.

Fighting zombies to playing a psychopath: The many faces of Choi Woo-shikLong before Choi Woo-shik became a household name thanks to Parasite, he had already amassed an impressive filmography. On this week's K-Fix, we'll have a closer look at his notable works, crafted long before his Oscar-winning turn in Parasite.

The Potato Lab trailer: Kang Tae-oh is set to headline upcoming rom-comThe trailer for The Potato Lab, a romantic comedy-drama starring Kang Tae-oh and Lee Sun-bin, has been released. The series, set in a rural potato research institute, promises a blend of romance, comedy, and workplace drama.

Dhoom Dhaam review: Romance meets thrill in this Yami Gautam-Pratik Gandhi filmReleased-Fri Feb 14, 2025Dhoom Dhaam movie review: Dhoom Dhaam blends romance with action and comedy, offering a refreshing alternative to traditional Valentine's Day films. Starring Yami Gautam and Pratik Gandhi, the movie delivers a thrilling and entertaining experience perfect for a cosy night in.

Scared of Loving You: Selena Gomez's new song for her Valentine Benny Blanco out Lovebirds Selena Gomez and Benny Blanco have now collaborated for a new album titled I Said I Love You First. On the occasion of Valentine's Day 2025, Selena released the first single from the album, Scared of Loving You.

general news.headline: Kumbh train, ticket sale surge behind Delhi stampede? What probe report saysDelhi railway station stampede: At least 18 people, including children and women, were killed in a stampede in the New Delhi Railway Station due to overcrowding of passengers waiting to board trains for the Maha Kumbh Mela.

Children, women among 18 dead as Kumbh rush triggers stampede at Delhi station  Live UpdatesDelhi station stampede: The tragic incident took place at around 10 pm on Saturday on platforms 13 and 14. Multiple videos have surfaced showing passengers rushing through the station, with some carrying children on their shoulders, while others struggle with their luggage.

Trump says no laws broken if he 'saves his country', quotes NapoleonDozens of lawsuits currently challenge Donald Trump's executive orders, including the ongoing crackdown against illegal immigration, attempts to ban transgender people from serving in the US military and efforts to overhaul the federal workforce.

US cuts $21 million grant for voter turnout in India, $29 million for BangladeshElon Musk's Department of Government Efficiency has announced a decision to cut $723 million in foreign aid funding as part of its broader budget overhaul plans.

Aftermath of Delhi station stampede: Shoes, belongings strewn, cops nowhereSeveral videos of the aftermath of the stampede at the New Delhi railway station, which killed 18 people, show massive crowds jostling through the station with their luggage. Several pairs of shoes and other belongings were found strewn on an escalator.
UP woman injected with HIV-infected needle by in-laws over unmet dowry demandThe woman's father alleged that his daughter had been subjected to constant torture by her in-laws over dowry demands.

People crossed tracks, barged into train: Eyewitnesses on Delhi stampede horrorEyewitnesses of the stampede at the New Delhi railway station that killed 18 said there was a huge rush as several people were heading towards Prayagraj for the Maha Kumbh. They alleged that there were no police personnel to manage the crowd.

Delhi stampede: Railway Minister says situation under control, probe orderedRailway Minister Ashwini Vaishnaw said four special trains were operated to handle the sudden rush of passengers heading to Prayagraj for the Maha Kumbh at the New Delhi railway station, where 18 people died in a stampede.

US, Russian officials to hold Ukraine war talks in Saudi, Zelenskyy 'not invited'Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelenskyy, who met with US Vice President JD Vance in Germany on Friday, said Ukraine was not invited to the talks in Saudi Arabia and Kyiv would not engage with Russia before consulting with strategic partners.

Andhra man tries to rape his aunts, mother kills him, dismembers bodyPrakasam Superintendent of Police, AR Damodar, said K Lakshmi Devi (57) allegedly murdered her son, K Shyam Prasad (35), a cleaner, on February 13.

Rishi Sunak visits Taj Mahal with wife, children and mother-in-law Sudha MurthyRishi Sunak, his wife Akshata Murty and their children Anoushka and Krishna are on an India tour and have been spotted having quality time with Narayana Murthy and Sudha Murthy.

US military aircraft with 116 illegal Indian immigrants lands in AmritsarThis is the second such batch of Indians deported by the Donald Trump administration as part of its crackdown on illegal immigration.
PM Modi 'distressed' over Delhi railway station stampede, condoles deathsAt least 18 people, including nine women, five children and four men, died in the incident, sources said.

People invading my mother's clinic, sending death threats: Ranveer Allahbadia YouTuber Ranveer Allahbadia revealed that he was scared for his life, claiming that he and his family have been receiving death threats over the past few days following his remarks at India's Got Latent.

Niki Prasad is here to stay after fairytale debut for Delhi Capitals WPL 2025: Reigning U19 World Cup winning captain Niki Prasad won the Player of the Match award against Mumbai Indians after making her debut for the Delhi Capitals on Saturday at the Kotambi Stadium in Vadodara.
Question Time: Weekly News QuizThink you read the headlines this week? Let's test that!

Where the dead warn the living: Darien Gap, deadliest stretch on donkey routeA second flight with over 100 Indians who migrated illegally to the US will land in Amritsar today. Most of them and others who are in the US illegally took the donkey route. The Darien Gap -- a 97-km stretch on the border of Columbia and Panama -- is the most dangerous part of the South American donkey route. Here's all about the Darien Gap and its dangers that have forced immigrants even to abandon their children.

Gold crown, gold sword: Jayalalithaa's seized assets transferred to Tamil NaduTamil Nadu officially received former Chief Minister J Jayalalithaa's seized assets, including 27.5 kg of gold, over a tonne of silver, and land documents. Karnataka authorities transferred the valuables under court supervision, revealing her vast wealth.

Chinese Chatter: Modi-Trump diplomacy sparks unease in BeijingChina's rise is a common concern for both the United States and India; therefore, relevant issues about China have most likely dominated the agenda of Modi and Trump's meeting.

Teen killed, 4 injured in Austria after Syrian man goes on stabbing rampageA 23-year-old Syrian asylum seeker stabbed several passersby in Austria on Saturday, killing a 14-year-old boy and injuring four other people, police said.

Mumbai bank scam: Employee reveals how RBI uncovered Rs 122 crore cash shortfallA routine audit at New India Cooperative Bank uncovered a Rs 122-crore cash shortfall. A senior bank employee's statement, accessed by India Today TV, revealed how RBI officials detected and confronted the massive financial discrepancy.

RCB vs KKR to flag off IPL 2025, Eden Gardens to host opener and finalRoyal Challengers Bengaluru and Kolkata Knight Riders will kick off the proceedings in the Indian Premier League's 2025 season. The final will also be played at the same venue, on May 25.

Chhaava box office Day 2: Vicky Kaushal film eyes Rs 100 crore by first weekend Vicky Kaushal's film Chhaava continues its impressive run at the box office, surpassing its opening day numbers with ease on Day 2. The movie is on track to become one of the biggest hits of 2025.

Amitabh Bachchan, Akshay Kumar, Sachin Tendulkar attend ISPL Season 2 finaleThe finale of the Indian Street Premier League (ISPL) was attended by several Bollywood and cricket stars, including Amitabh Bachchan, Sachin Tendulkar, Akshay Kumar and others. The final was played between Majhi Mumbai and Srinagar Ke Veer. Big B was there to support the Majhi Mumbai team.

Kalamkaval: Mammmootty shares first look poster from Jithin K Jose's filmMalayalam superstar Mammootty shared his first look poster from the upcoming Kalamkaval. Headlined by Vinayakan, it has been touted that Mammootty will play an anti-hero in the film.

However, the Rohit Sharma-led side has been jolted by the absence of their ace speedster Jasprit Bumrah for the mega event. Hence, they have a herculean task of going all the way in the tournament without their biggest match-winner in recent times.

Spain script Paris revenge on India with 3-1 win in Pre League HockeySpain avenged their Olympic defeat with a 3-1 victory over India in the FIH Pro League, capitalising on defensive lapses and penalty corners. Despite taking an early lead, India struggled with cohesion and execution throughout the match.

education.headline: The role of data analytics in modern advertising educationThis transformation also exercises a significant impact on the realm of 'advertising education.'

NCERT deletes Azad Pak, adds China's aggression reference in Class 12 textbookThe NCERT has made final changes to its Class 12 Political Science textbook syllabus for the upcoming academic year, including a revision in reference to India's border situation with China, Azad Pakistan, Article 370 and more.

NEET row: Bihar cops find 6 post-dated cheques 'issued for question paper brokers'Six post-dated cheques which were suspected to have been issued in favour of mafia demanding over Rs 30 lakh from each candidate seeking alleged leaked question paper ahead of NEET held last month were recovered by Bihar Police.

Forest fires surge tenfold from 2004 to 2017: Causes, impact and preventionAmidst a relentless surge, intense forest fires are now multiplying tenfold, casting a menacing shadow over our flora and fauna. Year by year, their fiery grip tightens, threatening ecosystems far and wide, now extending their reach to impact human lives.

Fresh plea in Supreme Court to recall NEET results, reconduct examsA fresh petition has been filed in the Supreme Court to recall the National Entrance cum Eligibility Test - Under Graduate (NEET-UG) 2024 results and re-conduct fresh examination after discrepancies in the declared results.

NTA issues clarification after NEET result controversy over toppers, high cut-offIn a detailed statement, the National Testing Agency (NTA) said that the increase in cut-off and number of toppers in the NEET-UG reflect the competitive nature of the exam and maintained that the test's integrity has not been compromised.

Exclusive: Arvind Kejriwal claims 'BJP succession war, PM backing Amit Shah'Speaking exclusively to India Today TV, Delhi Chief Minister Arvind Kejriwal claimed that there is a "succession war" within the BJP. He also claimed that the ruling party is "not fighting the Lok Sabha elections as a team".

4 medical students arrested in Bihar for appearing as proxies for NEET aspirantsFour MBBS students who appeared in place of NEET aspirants in the medical entrance exam were detained in Bihar's Purnea.

NEET-UG question paper not leaked, claims baseless: National Testing AgencyThe reports claiming question paper leak in the medical entrance exam NEET-UG are "completely baseless and without any ground", the National Testing Agency (NTA) has clarified.
The generation with answers: Tech-savvy Indian youth tackling global challengesIndia's tech-savvy youth rewriting the global narrative, one solution at a time.

Left sweeps JNU students' polls, Dhananjay is first Dalit presidentThe Left swept the Jawaharlal Nehru University Students' Union (JNUSU) polls, winning all four posts and trouncing the RSS-affiliated ABVP. The ABVP was leading at one point, but the Left eventually surged ahead and emerged victorious.
